name: Egg Curry
history: Egg Curry is a popular dish in various regions of India, each with its own version. It's a flavorful and protein-rich curry that's often a home-cooked favorite.
description: Egg Curry consists of hard-boiled eggs simmered in a spicy and tangy tomato-based sauce. The sauce is typically seasoned with traditional Indian spices, making it a hearty and comforting dish.

instructions.title: Boil the Eggs
instructions.description: Boil the eggs until hard-boiled, then peel and set aside.

instructions.title: Prepare the Curry Base
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add onions and cook until golden brown. Stir in ginger-garlic paste.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Tomatoes
instructions.description: Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a minute. Add tomato puree and simmer until oil separates.

instructions.title: Add Eggs to the Curry
instructions.description: Add the boiled eggs to the curry. Pour in water and simmer for 10 minutes.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Stir in garam masala and simmer for another 2 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or Indian breads.

tips: Prick the eggs with a fork before adding to the curry for better absorption of flavors.
Adjust the chili powder and garam masala according to your taste preference.
variations: Add a splash of cream or coconut milk for a richer gravy.
Include potatoes or peas for additional texture and flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl, garnished with a sprig of coriander.
Pair with a cooling cucumber raita or salad.
